blog.name: imagine-hs
blog.title: Imagine Harry Styles
blog.description:
I write little and sometimes longer stories about YOU and Harry Styles.
Masterpost: http://tinyurl.com/nqglzls

title: Wrong Number!
body:
I watched “Sierra Burgess Is A Loser” yesterday. What a brilliant movie! If you haven’t seen it yet, go watch it… after reading my imagine of course 😅.

Anywho, it inspired me to write a similar situation with Harry as the main guy. Harry in a RomCom is what we deserve after all, and if he doesn’t make it happen we’ll just imagine him into the existing ones 😉

So enjoy and, as always, let me know what you think 😘

Your phone vibrated, sending a jolt of excitement through you. Hopefully it was a first response to the ad you had put up at the grocery store that morning, offering tutoring.

Unknown Number: Hey there!

You frowned. Was that how one started a message to a potential employee these days?

You: Who is this?

Unknown Number:

Holy shit! This guy was hot!

And looked kinda familiar…

You: Aaah, hey, what’s up?

Unknown: You don’t remember me, do you?

You: Sure I do… you’re that guy, from that place… 😅

Unknown: 😂 Yeah right. I figured you were the kind of person who probably gave out her number a few times a night. It’s Harry, from the Sony party.

Your eyes widened. You had never been to a Sony party in your life, but you knew someone who kept bragging about going, just because her dad had “connections”. And true, she was the kind of girl who gave out her number a lot, or what people assumed was her number. You had heard from others who had fallen victim to her schemes, but this was a first for you.

Hm, maybe there was a way to turn this back on her.

You: Riiiight, Harry! Sorry about that. Fighting a cold, my head’s a little fuzzy.

Harry: Oh, I’m sorry. You should drink a lot of tea and just stay in bed and watch Netflix.

You grinned. You had to give it to him, he was charming.

You: Oh yeah, any recommendations?

Harry: Hm, To All The Boys I’ve Loved Before was really good!

…

Wait, no, forget that. What I mean is, um, you know, Mission Impossible or something.

You: Way to save your manliness 😜

Harry: I know, right? Close call 🙈

You: 😂😂😂

Harry: Are you gonna hold that against me?

You: Only if To All The Boys I’ve Loved Before isn’t actually good!

Harry: It really is! It’s very sweet and cute and funny!

You: Then you got nothing to worry about 😉

With a grin you put your phone aside and unpaused the movie that had been playing on your computer.

“And Josh, but he’s my sister’s boyfriend.”, the pretty Asian girl’s voice-over was just saying.

Great minds, you thought.

Fifteen minutes passed before your phone vibrated again.

Harry: So, have I lost out to Peter Kavinsky yet?

You: Not quite, but I’m only about halfway through 😏

Harry: And you haven’t fallen in love with him yet? Hm, maybe you’re more cold-hearted than I thought.

You: I didn’t say that, all I meant is that you haven’t lost out yet…

Harry: …I see.

You: 😄

He IS pretty dreamy though, so don’t get your hopes up.

Harry: That’s ok, I tend not to.

You: Wow, that sounds depressing.

Harry: No, no. I just mean I’m a very realistic person. I know when I’m wasting my time on something and when not.

You: What does that mean about deciding to text me?

Harry: 😁😁😁😁

You kept texting, talking about the movie and real life. You figured he didn’t know much about the other girl, so you felt secure telling him personal things. In return he told you a lot about himself as well. You joked and flirted and were very serious at times. At some point the movie had ended, but you didn’t notice. You were too engrossed in your conversation. Until…

Harry: Holy crap, it’s 3am! I got work in the morning.

You: Woah, me too 😱

Harry: What do you do?

You: Actually, I have a few jobs. In the mornings I work at the animal clinic and in the evening at the movie theater.

Harry: Cool, maybe I’ll stop by tonight then.

Your heart clenched in panic. Oh no, what had you done?

You: Sorry, I mean I workED at the movie theater, I quit last week. It’s pretty new 😅 Now I do tutoring sessions in the evening.

Ok, that wasn’t a total lie. On the nights you had off from the theater you tutored.

Harry: Ah, too bad, I was hoping to get into movies for free 🤔

You: Haha sorry. But if you need tutoring, I’m your girl.

Harry: I like the sound of that. Goodnight, tutor girl 🌚

You stared at your phone for a while after that. You should have probably texted back, saying goodnight as well, but it seemed more perfect that way. You decided that it had gone too far already. You were not the kind of person who catfished someone. As of tomorrow, er, later today, you would stop texting Harry, before it went horribly wrong.

Yes, you’d stop. For sure.


To be continued…

blog.name: harrysofluffy
blog.title: Babystache.
blog.description:
. H // 22 // AUS .

||TILL THE END OF TIME||

||MASTERLIST||

summary: There are SO many good ones! But I just give you these two to choose from. Harr and Y/N please :) “They got you a present. Isn’t...
question: There are SO many good ones! But I just give you these two to choose from. Harr and Y/N please :) “They got you a present. Isn’t it sweet?” or “I’m worried about losing my job!”
answer:
Here you go, sorry for taking so long. I had the idea but it just didn’t want to write.

blurb - fluff, toddlers - words 800

—

Fee was in a mood. A right rotten mood and it was quickly wearing you out. Not even when Harry tried to hold her was she relaxed. Every time he tried to take her from your arms she would just scream and lock her arms around your neck so he couldn’t take her from you. That was the biggest sign that something was wrong, she loved Harry and she never reacted like that when he wanted to hold her.

“I can take her.” He said once again that night. “I don’t want you getting hurt.” His eyes glanced down to your six-month belly and he frowned a bit at the weight Fee was putting on you.

“It’s fine.” You said exhausted as you walked beside him to his dressing room at the arena.

“She’s almost asleep, just let me take her.” You shook your head at him, her sour mood tainting yours.  

She was almost asleep, her head buried in your neck, eyelashes fluttering against your skin as she tried to fight off sleep. If she was comfortable in your arms and almost asleep you didn’t want to disturb her.

“Hello Harry, how are you?” You were stopped just before you could get into the privacy of Harry’s dressing room by Dan, the owner of the arena, someone you had only meet very briefly once before.

Harry smiled at Dan and quickly reached out to shake his hand. “I’m really great, thanks for having me back.”

Fee started to cry against your neck at the pause in the hallway and she drew her head back to see what was happening, her fingers pressing into her mouth to which you frowned out. Her cries grew a little louder and she flicked her watery eyes towards Harry in a beg for him to keep moving. She didn’t want to be in the hustle and bustle of the arena anymore and neither did you really.

“Hello Fee,” Dan started softly, not fazed by her tears and her dissatisfaction. “Last time I saw you, you were in there.” He said pointing at your belly.

You laughed a little at his words, you barely had a bump the last time you saw him and were surprised that he remembered it. Bouncing Fee slightly you tried to see if she would stop frowning at Dan but no luck. A tired smile crossed your lips as he pulled out a soft stuffed dog from his pocket and held it out to her. Fee whined and tucked her head back into your neck, hiding herself away and you felt some dribble on your shoulder.

“Fee… Dan got you a present. Isn’t it sweet?” You tried again to get her to interact with Dan but she just shook her head.

“I’m sorry,” you said softly to Dan. Reaching up you took the dog from his hand and tucked it in next to Fee’s side. “She’ll love it but I think she’s getting a bit sick and over it.”

Dan smiled and held up his hands in defence. “It’s fine YN, don’t worry that’s kids. Congratulations for this one too.” Dan stepped in close to you and gave you a quick hug and a quick kiss on the cheek before moving back and shaking Harry’s hand. “Congratulations to you to and have a great show.”

Harry thanked Dan and once he was gone you quickly continued to Harry’s dressing room understanding much better what was troubling your baby girl. Harry shut the door to the room and you were bathed in silence.

“YN if you won’t let me take her please sit down.” Harry reached his hands out to take Fee from you again but you shock your head at him.

“Fee,” You tried gently taking her hand and trying to pull her back to look at you.

Her entire fist had made its way into her mouth now and you watched his lips drop into a frown realising what you already had. “Poor Feefee, daddy get you some medicine for your teethy’s okay then you’ll feel better.” Harry reached up and ran a hand through Fee’s hair before turning and finding the pain killers in the baby bag.

After Harry had given Fee her medicine she calmed right down, her tears dried and happily went to Harry. You smiled from your comfortable seat on the couch, hand caressing over your belly as you watched Harry getting his hair done for the show. Fee was asleep against his chest, the dog clutched beneath her arm and a fluffy blanket wrapped around her with Harry’s hand brushing through her curls.

Even though only an hour ago she cried when Harry tried to take her she now clutched at him and slept comfortably against the warmth of him. Fee was always going to be a daddy’s girl and it always made your heart flutter at the sight and always would.

Harry smiled at Dan and quickly reached out to shake his hand. “I’m really great, thanks for having me back.”

Fee started to cry against your neck at the pause in the hallway and she drew her head back to see what was happening, her fingers pressing into her mouth to which you frowned out. Her cries grew a little louder and she flicked her watery eyes towards Harry in a beg for him to keep moving. She didn’t want to be in the hustle and bustle of the arena anymore and neither did you really.

“Hello Fee,” Dan started softly, not fazed by her tears and her dissatisfaction. “Last time I saw you, you were in there.” He said pointing at your belly.

You laughed a little at his words, you barely had a bump the last time you saw him and were surprised that he remembered it. Bouncing Fee slightly you tried to see if she would stop frowning at Dan but no luck. A tired smile crossed your lips as he pulled out a soft stuffed dog from his pocket and held it out to her. Fee whined and tucked her head back into your neck, hiding herself away and you felt some dribble on your shoulder.

“Fee… Dan got you a present. Isn’t it sweet?” You tried again to get her to interact with Dan but she just shook her head.

“I’m sorry,” you said softly to Dan. Reaching up you took the dog from his hand and tucked it in next to Fee’s side. “She’ll love it but I think she’s getting a bit sick and over it.”

Dan smiled and held up his hands in defence. “It’s fine YN, don’t worry that’s kids. Congratulations for this one too.” Dan stepped in close to you and gave you a quick hug and a quick kiss on the cheek before moving back and shaking Harry’s hand. “Congratulations to you to and have a great show.”

Harry thanked Dan and once he was gone you quickly continued to Harry’s dressing room understanding much better what was troubling your baby girl. Harry shut the door to the room and you were bathed in silence.

“YN if you won’t let me take her please sit down.” Harry reached his hands out to take Fee from you again but you shock your head at him.

“Fee,” You tried gently taking her hand and trying to pull her back to look at you.

Her entire fist had made its way into her mouth now and you watched his lips drop into a frown realising what you already had. “Poor Feefee, daddy get you some medicine for your teethy’s okay then you’ll feel better.” Harry reached up and ran a hand through Fee’s hair before turning and finding the pain killers in the baby bag.

After Harry had given Fee her medicine she calmed right down, her tears dried and happily went to Harry. You smiled from your comfortable seat on the couch, hand caressing over your belly as you watched Harry getting his hair done for the show. Fee was asleep against his chest, the dog clutched beneath her arm and a fluffy blanket wrapped around her with Harry’s hand brushing through her curls.

Even though only an hour ago she cried when Harry tried to take her she now clutched at him and slept comfortably against the warmth of him. Fee was always going to be a daddy’s girl and it always made your heart flutter at the sight and always would.

trail.content_raw:
Here you go, sorry for taking so long. I had the idea but it just didn’t want to write.

blurb - fluff, toddlers - words 800

—

Fee was in a mood. A right rotten mood and it was quickly wearing you out. Not even when Harry tried to hold her was she relaxed. Every time he tried to take her from your arms she would just scream and lock her arms around your neck so he couldn’t take her from you. That was the biggest sign that something was wrong, she loved Harry and she never reacted like that when he wanted to hold her.

“I can take her.” He said once again that night. “I don’t want you getting hurt.” His eyes glanced down to your six-month belly and he frowned a bit at the weight Fee was putting on you.

“It’s fine.” You said exhausted as you walked beside him to his dressing room at the arena.

“She’s almost asleep, just let me take her.” You shook your head at him, her sour mood tainting yours.  

She was almost asleep, her head buried in your neck, eyelashes fluttering against your skin as she tried to fight off sleep. If she was comfortable in your arms and almost asleep you didn’t want to disturb her.

“Hello Harry, how are you?” You were stopped just before you could get into the privacy of Harry’s dressing room by Dan, the owner of the arena, someone you had only meet very briefly once before.

Harry smiled at Dan and quickly reached out to shake his hand. “I’m really great, thanks for having me back.”

Fee started to cry against your neck at the pause in the hallway and she drew her head back to see what was happening, her fingers pressing into her mouth to which you frowned out. Her cries grew a little louder and she flicked her watery eyes towards Harry in a beg for him to keep moving. She didn’t want to be in the hustle and bustle of the arena anymore and neither did you really.

“Hello Fee,” Dan started softly, not fazed by her tears and her dissatisfaction. “Last time I saw you, you were in there.” He said pointing at your belly.

You laughed a little at his words, you barely had a bump the last time you saw him and were surprised that he remembered it. Bouncing Fee slightly you tried to see if she would stop frowning at Dan but no luck. A tired smile crossed your lips as he pulled out a soft stuffed dog from his pocket and held it out to her. Fee whined and tucked her head back into your neck, hiding herself away and you felt some dribble on your shoulder.

“Fee… Dan got you a present. Isn’t it sweet?” You tried again to get her to interact with Dan but she just shook her head.

“I’m sorry,” you said softly to Dan. Reaching up you took the dog from his hand and tucked it in next to Fee’s side. “She’ll love it but I think she’s getting a bit sick and over it.”

Dan smiled and held up his hands in defence. “It’s fine YN, don’t worry that’s kids. Congratulations for this one too.” Dan stepped in close to you and gave you a quick hug and a quick kiss on the cheek before moving back and shaking Harry’s hand. “Congratulations to you to and have a great show.”

Harry thanked Dan and once he was gone you quickly continued to Harry’s dressing room understanding much better what was troubling your baby girl. Harry shut the door to the room and you were bathed in silence.

“YN if you won’t let me take her please sit down.” Harry reached his hands out to take Fee from you again but you shock your head at him.

“Fee,” You tried gently taking her hand and trying to pull her back to look at you.

Her entire fist had made its way into her mouth now and you watched his lips drop into a frown realising what you already had. “Poor Feefee, daddy get you some medicine for your teethy’s okay then you’ll feel better.” Harry reached up and ran a hand through Fee’s hair before turning and finding the pain killers in the baby bag.

After Harry had given Fee her medicine she calmed right down, her tears dried and happily went to Harry. You smiled from your comfortable seat on the couch, hand caressing over your belly as you watched Harry getting his hair done for the show. Fee was asleep against his chest, the dog clutched beneath her arm and a fluffy blanket wrapped around her with Harry’s hand brushing through her curls.

Even though only an hour ago she cried when Harry tried to take her she now clutched at him and slept comfortably against the warmth of him. Fee was always going to be a daddy’s girl and it always made your heart flutter at the sight and always would.

blog.description: Emma. 20. Something I do for fun! Request are closed. Updating schedule. and I also have a Masterlist

body:
Chapter three is coming today!

Yes I am back!

While writing chapter three, I was never happy with the result. Now that I took my time with it, I changed the concept of the story a bit and I am so excited with how the story will further evolve.

The first two chapters won’t change so don’t worry!

Again super sorry that I haven’t been active this past week.

Also I will keep working on the requests in my asks so don’t worry if you requested something or feel like requesting something. I will do it!

Lovee you all! Xx

title: Beautiful Thing
body:
Without you here I am boring. Something inside you is triggering, it makes me myself, makes me funny. You’re a beautiful thing.

11

Never would I had thought that I would wake up next to Harry Styles in the morning. It was always a fantasy of mine I had when I went through my… I guess you can call it, “Missing Harry” phase; but…

Read more…
